chunks.en: Talking about my days staying in a hostel in London
This year I didn't go home for Chinese New Year. Instead, I secretlyç’ç€å®¶äººå’Œæ‰€æœ‰åŒäº‹ran off to Europe by myself, wandering around Britain and Ireland.
What impressed me most were my days staying in a hostel in London.
During that time, I met a middle-aged white man in the same dorm, about forty or fifty years old. There were also 3 Belgian girls and their 2 male friends in the dorm.

![The hostel I stayed in]( https://i.ibb.co/hFSYsJ2m/IMG20250129171259.jpg â€œThe hostel I stayed inâ€)

The white man went to bed early. The first night I returned to the dorm, he was already asleep. I didn't see him until the next afternoon. At that time, there were only two of us in the dorm. He came back from work and took a shower. He asked me if I liked men or women, and if I was gay. He said he was bi, and then he actually showed me his dick. He asked me if I had ever tried marijuana. Now, I am not the kind of person who turns pale at the mention of marijuana, because I had smoked a few puffs in Italy before, but I didn't feel anything. From what I understand, marijuana is actually less addictive than regular cigarettes.

I was just a little afraid that he would do something to me, so I quickly went out. But the streets of London were too cold. I took a few steps and went back to the dorm. I thought, after all, this is a hostel, and he looks kind, so he definitely wouldn't do anything too outrageous in public.
I returned to the dorm and learned that he was Irish and worked on a construction site.
The next night he went to bed very early again. The Belgian girls came back late and disturbed him. The white man scolded them.

Then the Belgians went downstairs to call the manager, falsely claiming that the white man had hit them. The manager moved him to another room and yelled at him. Actually, the white man was a bit wronged, after all, he was disturbed while resting.
I thought this was the end and I wouldn't see him again.

The next night I went to the bar downstairs and ran into him again. He took the initiative to say hello to me. I asked him how he slept yesterday. He said that he hadn't fallen asleep since he changed rooms, so he lay in the hall until dawn.
I told him that tonight was my last night in London and I would be returning to China tomorrow.
He said, "You should celebrate this last night. You know, when you leave here, everything will return to reality."
The white man was also quite outgoing. Anyone who walked past him, once there was eye contact, would take the initiative to say hello. He told me that this was one of their habits.
He gave me his email address and told me that even if I returned to China, we should stay in touch.
Then we went out to buy two bottles of wine. On the way back, he took two puffs of marijuana and asked me if I wanted to try it. I took a few puffs, but didn't feel anything at all.
Because the marijuana was rolled into a cigarette, I felt like vomiting. Later, we returned to the bar and continued chatting with people around us.

I met a lesbian couple, one from Germany and one from Switzerland. The Swiss girl was very gentle and polite. We chatted for two hours, during which we went out of the hostel to the street and chatted, then returned to the hostel.
We chatted until the bar closed. I exchanged Instagram with the lesbian couple. The next day I checked out, took another two walks in the afternoon, and flew back to China at night.
If you encounter experiences such as sexual harassment or being induced to smoke marijuana in China, the tone of the comments on V2EX would definitely not be "interesting" or similar.
Going out/returning home for a while is like having a dream.

A few years after getting married in my thirties, I went to Europe on a business trip and then drove around Germany alone for about 10 days. I stayed in hostels the whole time and had similar experiences to the poster, deeply feeling the freedom of Europeans.
There were mechanical engineers traveling to various places from hostels for work, and German college students partying with friends.
There was also a Malaysian guy who quit Huawei and started traveling around Europe.
If I have a child in the future, I will let him travel around the world.
Marijuana smells like pesticide ğŸ¤®, and OP actually took a few puffs.
Going to London alone is quite impressive.
I want to ask, what interesting things did you do during the trip?
Which attractions did you go to?
How much did it cost in total this time?
@gushu #37 That's different. The motivations behind the same behavior vary greatly in different cultural contexts.

In East Asian culture, someone showing you their jiji is almost certainly motivated by harassment; but in some Western cultural contexts, I can understand this behavior as more of sharing and communication.
Those who disagree can scold me! ğŸ˜‚
@yukino It really smells bad.
@lucasj It's not impressive, just taking a plane.
The whole trip cost 10,000 yuan. I didn't visit any paid attractions. Personally, I don't like visiting attractions. I like to stay in one place for a few days and experience life.

Looking back now, the London hostels of that time were so innocent.

I also wander around a lot and have always wanted to stay in hostels, but I'm worried that my English is too poor to communicate with others...
OP secretly rejoiced that his chrysanthemum was intact.
I have also met men who showed me "that thing" and asked me to touch their anus. I felt disgusted and ran away.
Well written, you really need to go out and see the colorful world more.
